events.name: Early Maya Settlements
events.description: The earliest Maya settlements begin to form in the Preclassic period.

events.name: Development of Writing System
events.description: The Maya develop a writing system that will become the most sophisticated in pre-Columbian Americas.

events.name: Rise of El Mirador
events.description: El Mirador becomes one of the largest cities in the preclassic Maya period.

events.name: Peak of Tikal
events.description: Tikal reaches its peak in power and influence during the Classic period.

events.name: Construction of Temple IV
events.description: The construction of Tikal's Temple IV, one of the tallest structures in the ancient Americas, is completed.

events.name: Fall of Teotihuacan
events.description: The fall of Teotihuacan significantly impacts the political dynamics of the Maya region.

events.name: Rise of Chichen Itza
events.description: Chichen Itza becomes a major regional capital, exerting influence over the northern Maya region.

events.name: Spanish Conquest
events.description: The Spanish conquer the last independent Maya city, Nojpeten, marking the end of the Maya civilization's political independence.
